skill.name: styling-with-shadcn
skill.description:
Build beautiful, accessible UIs with shadcn/ui components in Next.js. Use when creating
forms, dialogs, tables, sidebars, or any UI components. Covers installation, component
patterns, react-hook-form + Zod validation, and dark mode setup.
NOT when building non-React applications or using different component libraries.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only code examples and reference files. No executable code that reads sensitive data, makes network calls, or executes external commands. The verify.py script only checks for file existence.

content.value_statement: Building accessible React components takes time and careful attention to keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes. This skill provides copy-paste shadcn/ui component patterns with form validation, dark mode, and responsive layouts for Next.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Create forms with react-hook-form and Zod validation
Build accessible dialogs and alert dialogs
Implement data tables with TanStack React Table
Add dark mode with next-themes provider
Configure sidebar navigation with state persistence
limitations: Requires Next.js 14+ and Tailwind CSS setup
Does not cover server components or advanced data fetching
Focused on UI patterns only, not backend integration

use_cases.title: Rapid UI prototyping
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold accessible component patterns for React applications without reading official documentation

use_cases.title: Form and table patterns
use_cases.description: Implement validated forms with error handling and data tables with sorting and pagination

use_cases.title: Custom theming
use_cases.description: Apply consistent design tokens and dark mode across a Next.js application

prompt_templates.title: Add button variants
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a shadcn/ui button with secondary variant and loading state for form submission

prompt_templates.title: Create validated form
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a task form with title, priority select, and description using react-hook-form and Zod schema

prompt_templates.title: Display data table
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a TanStack data table with title, status, priority columns and sortable headers

prompt_templates.title: Configure dark mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Add dark mode toggle with next-themes and a dropdown menu component

output_examples.input: Create a shadcn/ui form with a text input and submit button
output: - Use Form, FormField, FormItem, FormLabel, FormControl, FormMessage from @/components/ui/form
- Wrap with Form component and use form.handleSubmit on the form element
- Display FormMessage for validation errors below each input

best_practices: Use TypeScript for type-safe form schemas with Zod
Add asChild prop to buttons inside Link components for proper Next.js integration
Include aria-describedby for dialog descriptions to improve screen reader support
anti_patterns: Hardcoding form validation rules instead of using Zod schemas
Using uncontrolled components when form state management is needed

faq.question: What versions of Next.js are supported?
faq.answer: shadcn/ui works with Next.js 14+ using App Router and Tailwind CSS 3.4+.

faq.question: Can I use this with Create React App?
faq.answer: shadcn/ui is designed for Next.js. CRA and Vite require additional configuration.

faq.question: Does this work with server components?
faq.answer: Use 'use client' directive for interactive components like forms and dialogs.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides code patterns. All data stays in your application.

faq.question: Why are my components not styling correctly?
faq.answer: Ensure you ran npx shadcn@latest init and added components to your project.

faq.question: How does this compare to Material UI or Ant Design?
faq.answer: shadcn/ui provides copy-paste source code rather than pre-built npm packages.
